title: Thunderbird Reminder will not dismiss or cancel so no access to my emails
content:
This morning I opened Thunderbird and a Google Calendar reminder popped up. I clicked 'Dismiss' but the reminder did not disappear. I tried clicking the X close button but the reminder did not disappear.

The problem is that this prevents all access Thunderbird. Nothing is selectable so I have no access to my emails or to any of the Thunderbird settings.

I tried reinstalling Thunderbird (without deleting my profile) and the Google Calendar reminder pops up again.

So I am really stuck!

Can anyone help solve this issue please.

title: Thunderbird 140 freezes “No response” (Windows 10 Pro)
content:
As soon as I open Thunderbird, the program freezes before I can click on anything. The password prompt box appears, but regardless of whether I click “Cancel” or try to enter the password, the program freezes and only displays “No response.” I am unable to click on any menu item, as the program freezes even then. I wanted to repair it via Windows, but only the “Uninstall” tab appears in the Control Panel, not “Repair”... It doesn't matter whether I start Thunderbird in safe mode or normal mode. The problem is the same. Version: Thunderbird x64 de 140.0.1 Does anyone have any idea how I can access my emails, which I urgently need? Many thanks! Ekki

title: gebruikers interface uniformeren
content:
In het menu van Thunderbird staan alle geopende e-mail in de tabblad balk. Behalve e-mail die geopend worden vanaf de pc (of NAs server) als opgeslagen .eml. Daarvoor wordt een soort nieuwe Thunderbird instance in Windows geopend.

De geopende mail in de tabbalk sluit je door op x achter de naam in de tabbalk te klikken, de vanuit de pc geopende eml bestanden moet je als windows app rechs boven afsluiten.

Als je meerdere e-mails hebt geopend, deels door op b.v. een binnenkomende mail te klikken, deels door er verband mee houdende opgeslagen mails (.eml) te opnenen en je het een ander wil sluiten moet je dus bij de ene mail op x in de tabbalk klikken en deels op x rechts boven in het scherm. Met als gevolg dat je om de haverklap op d verkeerde x drukt en Thunderbird wordt afgesloten.

Waarom worden opgeslagen .eml bestanden niet gewoon binnen Thunderbird geopend en in de tab balk geplaatst. Dat voorkomt regelmatig ongewenst sluiten van Thunderbird. En b.v. dat als je daarbij de vraag krijgt of je wijzigingen wilt opslaan en nee zegt openstaande concepten ook weg zijn.

Dus graag het userinterfac uniformeren.

  • Alle e-mail openen als nieuwe instance van athunderbird
  • Of alle e-mail openen en in de tabbalk zetten.
creator: firefox@vangelder.nl

title: Folder flags
content: Every now and then a folder flag will change to the drafts flag/icon, it seems to be a random occurrence which can happen to any sub-folder. Up until the most recent Thunderbird upgrade I had a working extension called FolderFlags which allowed me to go into the Folder properties and change it back but that extension no longer works with the latest version of Thunderbird and there is no alternative extension. How do I change the flag back to it showing as an ordinary sub-folder in my Inbox instead of Drafts? As an interim measure I've created a new sub-folder and copied the emails from the old into the new but that's not ideal at all. I hope somebody will create an updated extension but has anyone any other suggestions please?
creator: kggr1993

title: Thunderbird and outlook.com mail
content:
Hi everybody,

Thunderbird is not download mail to the client inbox. I created the mailsadress today, freshly installed TB too. I set up the outlook.com account in TB and TB is establishing a connection with the mailserver, but not loading the mails. every time it tries to connect I can see TBgoing through the motions in status in the bottom left. There are mails in the accounts inbox,TB is just not downloading them. I also tried sending mails a mail to myself, from within TB, works fine. The mail sent via TB arrived in the acount inbox, visible in the webapp.

Please help, THX

already double checked Server Settings: 

   IMAP:        Incoming Server: outlook.office365.com        Port: 993        Security: SSL/TLS        Authentication: OAuth2    SMTP:        Outgoing Server: smtp.office365.com        Port: 587        Security: STARTTLS        Authentication: OAuth2
creator: oliver.bluethgen

title: Not able to send emails; able to receive emails
content:
I am able to receive emails on Thunderbird but I am not able to send emails to anybody from Thunderbird. That happens on two computers I have. I am able to send emails from Outlook. Therefore, it is not my email provider's (BluePeak) problem. When I try to send an email from Thunderbird, I receive the following error message: “Sending the message failed. SSL received a record with an incorrect Message Authorization Code. The configuration related to must be corrected.”

Please help me resolve this issue. Thank you very much!
